translations: v.使……结晶；使具体化；给（水果或花瓣）裹上糖霜；将浮动费用改为固定费用（crystallise 的过去式和过去分词）

phrs.translation: 后天结晶智商, 后天智商

sentences.sentence: A history of suffering and struggle has crystallised on his shoulders.
sentences.translation: 痛苦和斗争的历史重担落在的他肩上。

sentences.sentence: Much of this capital gain never crystallised, it was not converted into cash.
sentences.translation: 这些资本收益的大部分从未露过真身，因为它们可不能被转成现金。

sentences.sentence: Processing plants can go back and forth between ethanol and crystallised sugar at the flick of a switch, depending on prices.
sentences.translation: 受价格影响，只要轻弹开关，加工厂就可以在乙醇和结晶糖之间转换。
